name: CRMI
title: Canonical Resource Management Infrastructure Implementation Guide
description: This implementation guide defines profiles, operations, capability statements and guidance to facilitate the content management lifecycle for authoring, publishing, distribution, and implementation of FHIR knowledge artifacts such as value sets, profiles, libraries, rules, and measures. The guide is intended to be used by specification and content implementation guide authors as both a dependency for validation of published artifacts, and a guide for construction and publication of content.

resource.description: When the artifact was approved by publisher.
resource.name: Artifact Approval Date

resource.description: A reference to a canonical resource
resource.name: Artifact Canonical Reference

resource.description: When the artifact is expected to be used.
resource.name: Artifact Effective Period

resource.description: Whether or not the referenced artifact is owned by the referencing artifact.
resource.name: Artifact Is Owned

resource.description: When the artifact was last reviewed by the publisher.
resource.name: Artifact Last Review Date

resource.description: Release notes for a release of an artifact.
resource.name: Artifact Release Description

resource.description: A human-friendly release label assigned for the version.
resource.name: Artifact Release Label

resource.description: Describes the clinical usage of the artifact.
resource.name: Artifact Usage

resource.description: Indicates the mechanism used to compare versions to determine which is more current.
resource.name: Artifact Version Algorithm

resource.description: Describes the versioning policy of the artifact.
resource.name: Artifact Version Policy

resource.description: A comment containing additional documentation, a review comment, usage guidance, or other relevant information from a particular user.
resource.name: Artifact Comment

resource.description: Provides a default value for a parameter definition.
resource.name: Default Value

resource.description: Specifies a term and its associated definition.
resource.name: Definition Term

resource.description: Specifies the expansion parameters that should be used to expand the ValueSet, or any ValueSets in the Library (or referenced by components of the Library).
resource.name: Expansion Parameters

resource.description: A FHIR Query URL pattern that corresponds to the data specified by the data requirement. If multiple FHIR Query URLs are present, they each contribute to the data specified by the data requirement (i.e. the union of the results of the FHIR Queries represents the complete data for the data requirement). This is not a resolveable URL, in that it will contain 1) No base canonical (i.e. it's a relative query), and 2) Parameters using tokens that are delimited using double-braces and the context parameters are dependent solely on the subjectType, according to the following: Patient: context.patientId, Practitioner: context.practitionerId, Organization: context.organizationId, Location: context.locationId, Device: context.deviceId.
resource.name: FHIR Query Pattern

resource.description: Specifies whether the related artifact is defining a primary citation for the artifact (i.e. one that should appear in the narrative for the artifact specification.
resource.name: Is Primary Citation

resource.description: Allows a given data requirement to be identified as "selective", meaning that it can be used as an additive criteria to filter a population. A selective data requirement is guaranteed to define a subset (not necessarily proper) of the initial population of an artifact. If multiple data requirements are marked selective, they all apply (i.e. AND semantics).
resource.name: Is Selective

resource.description: An OperationOutcome that contains any information, warning, and/or error messages that were generated while processing an operation such as $evaluate or $prepopulate.
resource.name: Messages

resource.description: Specifies whether the profile should be included in the model info constructed for an artifact collection such as an implementation guide. If this extension is not present, included is true by default for resources and profiles, but not data types (unless they are indirectly referenced by included resources or profiles). Note that even if isIncluded is false for a resource or profile, it will still be included in model info if it is a required dependency of some other included resource, profile, or data type.
resource.name: ModelInfo Is Included

resource.description: Specifies whether the class constructed for the profile should be marked as retrievable in the model info (meaning whether or not it can appear as the target of a retrieve expression). If this value is not specified, retrievable is true for resources and false for data types.
resource.name: ModelInfo Is Retrievable

resource.description: Specifies the label for the class constructed in the model info for the profile (i.e. an alternative, user-friendly name that can be used as the identifier for the class in CQL expressions).
resource.name: ModelInfo Label

resource.description: Specifies the primary code path for the class constructed in the model info for the profile (i.e. the path to the code-valued element on the resource that should be used as the default terminology filter when no terminology target is specified in a CQL retrieve).
resource.name: ModelInfo Primary Code Path

resource.description: Specifies the settings to be used for constructing modelinfo from profile definitions.
resource.name: ModelInfo Settings

resource.description: A logical reference (e.g. a reference to ValueSet.url) to a value set/version that identifies a set of possible coded values representing activities that were not requested, ordered, or performed.
resource.name: Not Done ValueSet

resource.description: Specifies the type of resource the canonical references.
resource.name: Resource Type

resource.description: Defines the scope of an artifact as a string of the form {namespace-name}[@{namespace-uri}]. Namespace name shall be a valid NPM package id, and namespace uri shall be a valid uri. For FHIR implementation guides, scope is inferred using the package id and the base canonical. e.g. fhir.cqf.common@http://fhir.org/guides/cqf/common. This extension can be used on Implementation Guides, Libraries, on any knowledge artifact, to declare the scope of the artifact. In the absence of an explicit scope declaration, the scope of an artifact is inferred based on the IG in which the artifact is defined.
resource.name: Scope

resource.description: Allows additional value-based filters to be specified as part of a data requirement.
resource.name: Value Filter

resource.description: A module definition library that contains the effective data requirements for an artifact (i.e. the calculated data requirements for the expressions directly referenced by the artifact structure).
resource.name: CRMI Effective Data Requirements

resource.description: Specifies the software systems used in the packaging and testing of knowledge artifacts. Specifically to support explicitly stating which versions of the various software components were used in the authoring, packaging, and testing.
resource.name: CRMI Software System

resource.description: The CRMI Capability Statement Profile enables capability statements to express supported CQL versions.
resource.name: CRMI Capability Statement

resource.description: Represents the definition of a careteam, suitable for use in various contexts
resource.name: CRMI CareTeamDefinition

resource.description: The CRMI Computable Library profile defines the must support elements for a computable library used to support artifact logic
resource.name: CRMI Computable Library

resource.description: Defines a computable value set as one that SHALL have an expression-based definition (i.e. a value set defined intensionally using expressions of the code systems involved) and MAY have an expansion included. The expression-based definition SHALL be represented in only one of three ways; using the compose element, using the expression extension, or using the rules-text extension to provide a step-by-step process for expanding the value set definition
resource.name: CRMI Computable ValueSet

resource.description: The CRMI Execuable Library profile defines the must support elements for an executable library used to support artifact logic
resource.name: CRMI Executable Library

resource.description: Defines an executable value set as one that SHALL have an expansion included, as well as a usage warning indicating the expansion is a point-in-time snapshot and must be maintained over time for production usage. The value set expansion specifies the timestamp when the expansion was produced, SHOULD contain the parameters used for the expansion, and SHALL contain the codes that are obtained by evaluating the value set definition. If this is ONLY an executable value set, a computable definition of the value set must be obtained to compute the updated expansion.
resource.name: CRMI Executable ValueSet

resource.description: Represents the definition of a group of subjects, suitable for use in various contexts, such as a cohort definition, a recommendation inclusion or exclusion criteria, the members of a study, or a population criteria
resource.name: CRMI GroupDefinition

resource.description: Represents the definition of a location, suitable for use in various contexts, such as a facility definition
resource.name: CRMI LocationDefinition

resource.description: Defines and supports the definition of a manifest used to establish specific versions of dependencies used in a collection of knowledge artifacts
resource.name: CRMI Manifest Library

resource.description: Represents the definition of a medication, suitable for use in various contexts
resource.name: CRMI MedicationDefinition

resource.description: Represents the definition of medication knowledge, suitable for use in various contexts
resource.name: CRMI MedicationKnowledge Definition

resource.description: The CRMI Model Information Library profile defines the must support elements for a computable Model Definition library used to support declaration and distribution of CQL ModelInfo such as the FHIR Model Info Library
resource.name: CRMI Model Info Library

resource.description: The CRMI Module Definition Library profile defines the must support elements for a library that communicates the effective data requirements and dependencies of an artifact (or set of artifacts). This is most commonly used as the result of a $data-requirements operation, but could also be persisted statically as a way to persist the calculation of effective data requirements for a specific artifact and input parameters
resource.name: CRMI Module Definition Library

resource.description: Represents the definition of a practitionerrole, suitable for use in various contexts
resource.name: CRMI PractitionerRoleDefinition

resource.description: Supports declaration of the ActivityDefinition metadata required by HL7 and other organizations that share and publish activity definitions with a focus on the aspects of that metadata that are important for post-publication activities including distribution, inclusion in repositories, consumption, and implementation.

See the Publishable and Authoring Artifact Repository capability statements for more comprehensive support for publishing and authoring workflows.

resource.description:
The definition of a value set is used to create a simple collection of codes suitable for use for data entry or validation. 

If the operation is not called at the instance level, one of the in parameters url, context or valueSet must be provided.  An expanded value set will be returned, or an OperationOutcome with an error message.
resource.name: CRMI Extension of Value Set Expansion

resource.description: SNOMED CT is a concept-based, scientifically validated terminology that provides a unique and permanent concept identifier that can be included in multiple HL7 data types including CD and CE.  The concepts are managed to avoid "semantic drift" so the meaning remains constant.  If the concept is found to be ambiguous or the meaning changes, the concept is inactivated but still retained and the identifier is never reused.    SNOMED CT's concepts are interrelated hierarchically and using description logic.    SNOMED CT concepts have a unique "fully-specified name", a preferred term, and, optionally, synonyms.  The description languages include English and Spanish.
resource.name: publishable-example-namingsystem

resource.description: SNOMED CT is a concept-based, scientifically validated terminology that provides a unique and permanent concept identifier that can be included in multiple HL7 data types including CD and CE.  The concepts are managed to avoid "semantic drift" so the meaning remains constant.  If the concept is found to be ambiguous or the meaning changes, the concept is inactivated but still retained and the identifier is never reused.    SNOMED CT's concepts are interrelated hierarchically and using description logic.    SNOMED CT concepts have a unique "fully-specified name", a preferred term, and, optionally, synonyms.  The description languages include English and Spanish.
resource.name: shareable-example-namingsystem
